prompt: Explain how bitcoin works like I am 10
response:
years old
So, you know how we use money to buy things we want, like toys and candy? Like dollars and coins?

Well, bitcoin is a special kind of money that exists only on computers and phones. It's like the money in your piggy bank, but instead of being made of coins and bills, it's made of computer code.

Just like how you can use your money to buy things you want, people can use bitcoin to buy things they want online, like video games or music. And just like how you can save your money in your piggy bank, people can save their bitcoins in a special kind of computer program called a "wallet".

But here's the really cool thing about bitcoin: it's like a secret code. Only the person who knows the code can use the bitcoin, so it's like having your very own super-safe, super-secret piggy bank!

And, just like how you can trade toys with your friends, people can trade bitcoins with each other. But instead of physically giving each other toys, they're sending each other secret codes that say "you now have some of my bitcoin".

Oh, and one more thing! Bitcoin is made by powerful computers solving very hard math problems. It's like a big game of "find the hidden treasure", and the computers that solve the problems get some brand new bitcoin as a prize!

Does that make sense? Do you have any questions? . Its one thing to say this how ever no books for children or adults on this subject written in plain English. 
(Ian Welsh, sick, may 2024 )
